skill.name: System Integration Validator
skill.description: Validates system integration before deployment. Use when checking ports, database connections, frontend-backend APIs, or debugging blocked/stuck workflows. Detects dead ends, bottlenecks, circular dependencies.
skill.summary: Validates system integrations before deployment with port checks, database tests, and data flow analysis.
skill.author: BarisSoizen

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code. Provides validation guidance only. No file access, network operations, or external command execution.

content.value_statement: Integration failures cause deployment delays and production incidents. This skill provides step-by-step validation for ports, databases, APIs, and data flows to catch issues early.
actual_capabilities: Check port availability with lsof commands
Verify PostgreSQL and Redis database connections
Detect dead ends, orphan inputs, and bottlenecks in data flows
limitations: Does not execute commands - provides guidance only
Requires user to run validation commands manually
Does not persist validation results between sessions

use_cases.title: Pre-deployment validation
use_cases.description: Run comprehensive port, database, and API checks before deploying to staging or production environments.

use_cases.title: Debug stuck workflows
use_cases.description: Identify circular dependencies and data flow issues that cause workflows to hang or fail silently.

use_cases.title: Verify API contracts
use_cases.description: Ensure frontend and backend API endpoints match to prevent integration bugs.

prompt_templates.title: Basic port check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if ports 3000, 3001, 5432, 6379, and 8080 are available on my local machine.

prompt_templates.title: Database connections
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify PostgreSQL and Redis connections are working on localhost. Show the commands to test each.

prompt_templates.title: API contract validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me validate that my frontend API calls match my backend endpoints. What should I check?

prompt_templates.title: Data flow analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my system for dead ends, orphan inputs, bottlenecks, and circular dependencies in the data flow.

output_examples.input: Validate my system integration before deployment
output: Port Check: All required ports (3000, 3001, 5432, 6379, 8080) are free
Database: PostgreSQL and Redis connections verified
API Contract: Frontend endpoints match backend definitions
Data Flow: No dead ends or circular dependencies detected

best_practices: Run port checks before starting any services to avoid conflicts
Test database connections with actual query/ping commands, not just socket tests
Use timeouts on all network operations to prevent hangs
anti_patterns: Skipping port checks and discovering conflicts at deployment time
Assuming database connection success means the database is fully functional
Ignoring data flow issues until users report broken workflows

faq.question: Which tools and platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code on any OS with standard networking tools.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides validation guidance only. You must run the actual commands yourself.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Use the validation steps as a template for your pipeline scripts. The skill outlines the commands to run.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides documentation. No data leaves your system.

faq.question: What if validation fails?
faq.answer: The skill provides troubleshooting guidance. Common fixes include freeing ports, starting services, or fixing API mismatches.

faq.question: How is this different from other testing tools?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on integration readiness before running tests. It catches environment issues early.
